name: .JPP File Extension
summary: Learn about .JPP files and view a list of programs that open them.

description: A JPP file is a page preview file created by Prescape Prinq RIP, a raster image processor (RIP) used in professional printing workflows. It stores a visual preview of a print job page, including the layout, alignment, and content. The Job Page Preview (JPP) format enables users to verify that documents appear as expected before final output, before the job is fully processed and sent to a printer.

content: Printing professionals, prepress operators, and graphic designers who work with Prinq RIP software in publishing and commercial printing environments are the primary users of JPP files. By generating a JPP file, Prinq RIP provides users with a quick way to review pages without committing ink, paper, or other production resources. These preview files are especially helpful when handling complex documents that contain images, fonts, or layered graphics.

instructions: You can open JPP files with Prescape Prinq RIP in Windows. To open a JPP file, select File â†’ Open.
